member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogMultiChannelReader.ReadMultiSample(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads one or more floating-point samples from one or more objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
member.returns: A 2D array of floating-point samples from the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from each of the channels. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .

remarks.para: NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

member.summary: Reads one or more analog waveform samples from one or more objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.

An initialized 1D array of that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a channel in the task. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .
member.returns: A reference to the parameter containing samples from the task.

remarks.para: If the data buffer is large enough to hold the number of samples requested, this overload attempts to reuse existing objects and their corresponding memory to acquire data. This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous analog input task.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
The data returned from analog waveform reads is affected by the property of the you are reading from.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

item.description: If is or is uninitialized;
If the first dimension of the does not match the number of channels; or
If is not , and the is not capable of holding the required number of samples.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error during the asynchronous operation.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogMultiChannelReader.BeginMemoryOptimizedReadWaveform(System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object,NationalInstruments.AnalogWaveform{System.Double}[])
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read of one or more analog waveform samples from one or more objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.

An initialized 1D array of that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a channel in the task. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: If the data buffer is large enough to hold the number of samples requested, this overload attempts to reuse existing objects and their corresponding memory to acquire data. This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous analog input task.
To get the read data or any exceptions that occurred during an asynchronous read initiated with , call with the returned .
NI-DAQmx scales the read data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
The data returned from analog waveform reads is affected by the property of the you are reading from.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogMultiChannelReader.MemoryOptimizedReadMultiSample(System.Int32,System.Double[0:,0:]@,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReallocationPolicy,System.Int32!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsLong@)
member.summary:
Reads one or more floating-point samples from one or more
objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.

An initialized 2D array of floating-point samples that contains the read data. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from each of the channels. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .
Dictates the reallocation behavior of the read operation. Refer to for more information.
The actual number of samples per channel read. This is useful when the reading operation yields fewer samples than the actual length of .
member.returns:
A reference to the
parameter containing samples from the task.

remarks.para: If the data buffer is large enough to hold the number of samples requested, this overload attempts to reuse existing memory allocated from the array to acquire data. This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous analog input task.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the
property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

item.description: If is or is uninitialized;
If the first dimension of the does not match the number of channels; or
If is not , and the is not capable of holding the required number of samples.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error during the asynchronous operation.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogMultiChannelReader.EndMemoryOptimizedReadMultiSample(System.IAsyncResult,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Handles the end of an asynchronous read initiated with
and retrieves the read samples.
member.param:
An
that represents an asynchronous call started by calling .
The actual number of samples per channel read. This is useful when the reading operation yields fewer samples than the actual length of .
member.returns: A 2D array of floating-point samples that contains the read data. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from each of the channels. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .

remarks.para:
If you call this method before the asynchronous read
is complete, it waits for the read to complete before returning.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the
property on the task you are reading from or writing to.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogSingleChannelReader.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that marshals event-handler and callback calls.
member.value: The representing the object that marshals the event-handler and callback calls. The default value is .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
When the value of this property is , event-handler and callback calls are raised in the default manner. This behavior could mean that the calls happen from a thread other than the main thread. Avoid this behavior by setting this property to an object that implements , such as a or .
For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogSingleChannelReader.SynchronizeCallbacks
member.summary: Specifies how events and callback delegates are invoked.
member.value: if events and callbacks are invoked through or . Otherwise, events and callbacks are invoked directly. The default value is .
member.remarks: In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. Therefore, you must take special care when accessing objects that have thread affinity, such as UI controls, from these callbacks and event handlers. For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogSingleChannelReader.MemoryOptimizedReadWaveform(System.Int32,NationalInstruments.AnalogWaveform{System.Double})
member.summary: Reads one or more analog waveform samples from a single in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An initialized that contains the read data.
member.returns: An containing samples from the task.

remarks.para: If the data buffer is large enough to hold the number of samples requested, this overload attempts to reuse existing objects and their corresponding memory to acquire data. This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous analog input task.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

member.summary: Reads a 32-bit integer sample from a counter task.
member.returns: A 32-bit integer sample from the task.
member.remarks:
Use this method when counter samples are returned unscaled, such as for event counting.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterReader.ReadMultiSampleDouble(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads one or more floating-point samples from a counter task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
member.returns: A 1D array of floating-point samples from the task. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel. NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

remarks.para: Use this method when counter samples are scaled to a floating-point value, such as for frequency and period measurement.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterReader.BeginReadSingleSampleDouble(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read of a single floating-point sample from a counter task.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: To get the read data or any exceptions that occurred during an asynchronous read initiated with , call with the returned .
Use this method when counter samples are scaled to a floating-point value, such as for frequency and period measurement.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterReader.EndReadSingleSampleDouble(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous read initiated with and retrieves the read samples.
member.param: An that represents an asynchronous call started by calling .

remarks.para: If you call before the asynchronous read represented by the provided is complete, waits for the read to complete before returning.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterReader.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that marshals event-handler and callback calls.
member.value: The representing the object that marshals the event-handler and callback calls. The default value is .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
When the value of this property is , event-handler and callback calls are raised in the default manner. This behavior could mean that the calls happen from a thread other than the main thread. Avoid this behavior by setting this property to an object that implements , such as a or .
For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterReader.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the object.
member.returns: A string representation of the object.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks: Overrides .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterReader.SynchronizeCallbacks
member.summary: Specifies how events and callback delegates are invoked.
member.value: if events and callbacks are invoked through or . Otherwise, events and callbacks are invoked directly. The default value is .
member.remarks: In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. Therefore, you must take special care when accessing objects that have thread affinity, such as UI controls, from these callbacks and event handlers. For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Library
Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterReader.BeginReadMultiSamplePulseFrequency(System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read of one or more pulse samples in terms of frequency from a counter task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: To get the read data or any exceptions that occurred during an asynchronous read initiated with , call with the returned .
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous read initiated with and retrieves the read samples.
member.param: An that represents an asynchronous call started by calling .
member.returns: A 1D array of pulse samples in terms of frequency from the task. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel.

remarks.para: If you call before the asynchronous read represented by the provided is complete, waits for the read to complete before returning.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterReader.MemoryOptimizedReadMultiSampleDouble(System.Int32,System.Double[]@,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReallocationPolicy,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads one or more samples from a single in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An initialized 1D array of samples that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel.
Dictates the reallocation behavior of . Refer to for more information.
The actual number of samples read. This is useful when the reading operation yields fewer or more samples than the actual length of .
member.returns: A reference to the parameter containing samples from the task.

remarks.para: When performing an asynchronous memory-optimized read, the size of the data buffer dynamically increases if the number of samples read exceeds the existing buffer and is . This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous counter input task. An is thrown if the buffer is not capable of holding the data and is .
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the
property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

item.description: If is or is uninitialized;
If the first dimension of does not match the number of channels; or
If is not , and is not capable of holding the required number of samples.

member.exception: There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterReader.MemoryOptimizedReadMultiSampleDouble(System.Int32,System.Double[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads one or more samples from a single in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An initialized 1D array of samples that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel.
The actual number of samples read. This is useful when the reading operation yields fewer or more samples than the actual length of .
member.returns: A reference to the parameter containing samples from the task.

remarks.para: If the data buffer is large enough to hold the number of samples requested, this overload attempts to reuse existing memory allocated from the array to acquire data. This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous counter input task. The memory allocation for the buffer is available to a maximum of 2 GB.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the
property on the task you are reading from or writing to.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterReader.EndMemoryOptimizedReadMultiSampleDouble(System.IAsyncResult,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous read initiated with and retrieves the read samples.
member.param: An that represents an asynchronous call started by calling .
The actual number of samples read. This is useful when the reading operation yields fewer or more samples than the actual length of .
member.returns: A 1D array of samples that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel.

remarks.para: If you call this method before the asynchronous read is complete, it waits for the read to complete before returning.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

item.description: If is or is uninitialized;
If the first dimension of the does not match the number of channels;
If is not , and the is not capable of holding the required number of samples; or
For asynchronous reads, if is or is not an instance of returned from a call to .

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error during the asynchronous operation.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.
member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter
member.summary: Contains methods for writing samples to one or more digital output channels in a task.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter.#ctor(NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class to write to the specified .
member.param: The to write to.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
Each object contains a property that serves as the connection point for writers to provide samples to be generated by that task.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter.WriteSingleSampleSingleLine(System.Boolean,System.Boolean[])
member.summary: Writes a single Boolean sample to one or more objects in a task.
member.param: If set to this method automatically calls if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to if you have installed events on the task.

A 1D array of Boolean samples to write to the task. Each element of the array corresponds to a channel within the task. The order of the channels in the array correspond to the order in which you add the channels to the task. The order of the lines in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the lines to the channel.
member.remarks:
This method fails if the channels in the task contain more than one digital line.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
This method returns immediately if the output buffer has sufficient space for the samples. Otherwise, the call is blocked until the application generates enough samples to fit the new data into the output buffer.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
has a non-zero lower bound.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter.WriteMultiSamplePort(System.Boolean,System.UInt32[0:,0:])
member.summary: Writes one or more 32-bit unsigned integer samples to one or more objects in a task.
member.param: If set to this method automatically calls if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to if you have installed events on the task.

A 2D array of 32-bit unsigned integer samples to write to the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample to write to each channel. The order of the channels in the array correspond to the order in which you add the channels to the task. The order of the lines in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the lines to the channel.
member.remarks:
Use this method for devices with up to 32 lines per port. If the task uses on-demand timing, this method returns only after the device generates all samples. If the task uses any timing type other than on-demand, this method returns immediately and does not wait for the device to generate all samples. Your application must call the method to block until the device has generated all samples.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
This method returns immediately if the output buffer has sufficient space for the samples. Otherwise, the call is blocked until the application generates enough samples to fit the new data into the output buffer.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
has a non-zero lower bound.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter.BeginWriteSingleSampleSingleLine(System.Boolean,System.Boolean[],System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous write of a single Boolean sample to one or more objects in a task.
member.param: If set to this method automatically calls if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to if you have installed events on the task.

A 1D array of Boolean samples to write to the task. Each element of the array corresponds to a channel within the task. The order of the channels in the array correspond to the order in which you add the channels to the task. The order of the lines in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the lines to the channel.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the write is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the write is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous write request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: Pass the returned to to get any exceptions that occurred during the asynchronous write or to wait for the write to complete.
This method fails if the channels in the task contain more than one digital line.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.

This method returns immediately if the output buffer has sufficient space for the samples. Otherwise, the call is blocked until the application generates enough samples to fit the new data into the output buffer.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter.EndWrite(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous write initiated with , , , , or .
member.param: An that represents an asynchronous call started by calling , , , , or .

remarks.para: If you call before the asynchronous write represented by the provided is complete, waits for the write to complete before returning. For a write to a buffered task, the write is considered complete when all of the written samples have been transferred to the task buffer. Use or on the object to determine if a task has generated all of the data it was configured to generate.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.exception: is or is not an instance of returned from a call to , , , , or .
The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error during the asynchronous operation.
The data passed to , , , , or has a non-zero lower bound.
member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that marshals event-handler and callback calls.
member.value: The representing the object that marshals the event-handler and callback calls. The default value is .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
When the value of this property is , event-handler and callback calls are raised in the default manner. This behavior could mean that the calls happen from a thread other than the main thread. Avoid this behavior by setting this property to an object that implements , such as a or .
For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.

Your application must call the method to block until the device has generated all samples.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelWriter.SynchronizeCallbacks
member.summary: Specifies how events and callback delegates are invoked.
member.value: if events and callbacks are invoked through or . Otherwise, events and callbacks are invoked directly. The default value is .
member.remarks: In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. Therefore, you must take special care when accessing objects that have thread affinity, such as UI controls, from these callbacks and event handlers. For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Library

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalSingleChannelWriter.EndWrite(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous write initiated with , , , , or .
member.param: An that represents an asynchronous call started by calling , , , , or .

remarks.para: If you call before the asynchronous write represented by the provided is complete, waits for the write to complete before returning. For a write to a buffered task, the write is considered complete when all of the written samples have been transferred to the task buffer. Use or on the object to determine if a task has generated all of the data it was configured to generate.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalSingleChannelWriter.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that marshals event-handler and callback calls.
member.value: The representing the object that marshals the event-handler and callback calls. The default value is .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
When the value of this property is , event-handler and callback calls are raised in the default manner. This behavior could mean that the calls happen from a thread other than the main thread. Avoid this behavior by setting this property to an object that implements , such as a or .
For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalSingleChannelWriter.WriteSingleSamplePort(System.Boolean,System.Int16)
member.summary: Writes a single 16-bit integer sample to a single in a task.
member.param: If set to this method automatically calls if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to if you have installed events on the task.
A sample to write to the task.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
Use this method for devices with up to 16 lines per port. If the task uses on-demand timing, this method returns only after the device generates all samples. If the task uses any timing type other than on-demand, this method returns immediately and does not wait for the device to generate all samples. Your application must call the method to block until the device has generated all samples.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
This method returns immediately if the output buffer has sufficient space for the samples. Otherwise, the call is blocked until the application generates enough samples to fit the new data into the output buffer.

A to write to the task. The order of the lines in the digital waveform corresponds to the order in which you add the lines to the channel.

If the task uses on-demand timing, this method returns only after the device generates all samples. If the task uses any timing type other than on-demand, this method returns immediately and does not wait for the device to generate all samples. Your application must call the method to block until the device has generated all samples.
Digital waveform writes are not affected by the or properties on the . To configure timing for digital waveform writes, use the method.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalSingleChannelWriter.SynchronizeCallbacks
member.summary: Specifies how events and callback delegates are invoked.
member.value: if events and callbacks are invoked through or . Otherwise, events and callbacks are invoked directly. The default value is .
member.remarks: In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read of a single 8-bit unsigned integer sample from one or more objects in a task.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: To get the read data or any exceptions that occurred during an asynchronous read initiated with , call with the returned .
Use this method for devices with up to eight lines per port.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelReader.EndReadSingleSamplePortByte(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous read initiated with and retrieves the read samples.
member.param: An that represents an asynchronous call started by calling .
member.returns: A 1D array of 8-bit unsigned integer samples from the task. Each element in the array corresponds to a channel in the task. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .

remarks.para: If you call before the asynchronous read represented by the provided is complete, waits for the read to complete before returning.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.exception: is or is not an instance of returned from a call to .
The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error during the asynchronous operation.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.
member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelReader.BeginReadMultiSamplePortByte(System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read of one or more 8-bit unsigned integer samples from one or more objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: To get the read data or any exceptions that occurred during an asynchronous read initiated with , call with the returned .
Use this method for devices with up to eight lines per port.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous read initiated with and retrieves the read samples.
member.param: An that represents an asynchronous call started by calling .
member.returns: A 2D array of 8-bit unsigned integer samples from the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from each channel. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelReader.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that marshals event-handler and callback calls.
member.value: The representing the object that marshals the event-handler and callback calls. The default value is .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
When the value of this property is , event-handler and callback calls are raised in the default manner. This behavior could mean that the calls happen from a thread other than the main thread. Avoid this behavior by setting this property to an object that implements , such as a or .
For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.summary: Reads one or more digital waveform samples from one or more objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalMultiChannelReader.SynchronizeCallbacks
member.summary: Specifies how events and callback delegates are invoked.
member.value: if events and callbacks are invoked through or . Otherwise, events and callbacks are invoked directly. The default value is .
member.remarks: In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. Therefore, you must take special care when accessing objects that have thread affinity, such as UI controls, from these callbacks and event handlers. For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalSingleChannelReader.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that marshals event-handler and callback calls.
member.value: The representing the object that marshals the event-handler and callback calls. The default value is .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
When the value of this property is , event-handler and callback calls are raised in the default manner. This behavior could mean that the calls happen from a thread other than the main thread. Avoid this behavior by setting this property to an object that implements , such as a or .
For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.returns: A 1D array of 16-bit integer samples from the task. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the task.

remarks.para: Use this method for devices with up to 16 lines per port.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DigitalSingleChannelReader.SynchronizeCallbacks
member.summary: Specifies how events and callback delegates are invoked.
member.value: if events and callbacks are invoked through or . Otherwise, events and callbacks are invoked directly. The default value is .
member.remarks: In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. Therefore, you must take special care when accessing objects that have thread affinity, such as UI controls, from these callbacks and event handlers. For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Library
Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SignalRoutingModifiers
member.summary: Specifies if the signal routed from the source terminal to the destination terminal is inverted.
member.remarks: If the device is not capable of signal inversion or if a previous route reserved the inversion circuitry in an incompatible configuration, attempting to invert the signal causes an error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SignalRoutingModifiers.InvertPolarity
member.summary: The signal is inverted.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannelCollection.CreateVoltageChannel(System.String,System.String,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AITerminalConfiguration,System.Double,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an with the specified custom scale to measure voltage. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to .
The input terminal configuration. To use the default terminal configuration for the physical channel(s) being used, pass a value of 1 casted to an .
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
member.returns: The newly created .

remarks.para: This method creates a local virtual channel for every physical channel name you specify. If you create multiple local virtual channels with one call to this method, you can specify a comma-delimited list of names for . If you provide fewer local virtual channel names in than you create, NI-DAQmx automatically assigns names to the local virtual channels.

If you do not provide a value for , NI-DAQmx uses the as the local virtual channel name. If you use to create a name for the local virtual channel, you must use this name in other properties and methods.

The NI-DAQmx driver does not determine if the requested settings are possible until the task is verified. does not throw an exception for parameter values that are not compatible with your hardware or other settings in your task. To determine if all of the settings for a are valid, you must verify the task by starting the task, either with or by reading from or writing to the task, or by calling with .
remarks.note: If the measurement requires the use of internal excitation or you need the voltage scaled by the excitation, use instead.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIChannelCollection.CreateFrequencyVoltageChannel(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an with the specified custom scale to measure frequency using a frequency-to-voltage converter. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to .
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in units.

The voltage level at which to recognize waveform repetitions. You should select a voltage level that occurs only once within the entire period of a waveform. You also can select a voltage that occurs only once while the voltage rises or falls.

A window, in volts, below . The input voltage must pass below minus before NI-DAQmx recognizes a waveform repetition. Hysteresis can improve the measurement accuracy when the signal contains noise or jitter.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
member.returns: The newly created .

member.summary: Creates an with the specified custom scale to measure strain. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to .
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The bridge configuration of the strain gage.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation in volts that the sensor requires.

The sensitivity of the strain gages and relates the change in electrical resistance to the change in strain. Each gage in the bridge must have the same gage factor. Refer to the sensor documentation to determine this value.

The output voltage of the bridge in the unloaded condition. NI-DAQmx subtracts this value from any measurements before applying scaling equations. Perform a voltage measurement on the bridge with no strain applied to determine this value.

The resistance in ohms of the gages in an unstrained position. Each gage in the bridge must have the same nominal gage resistance. The resistance across arms of the bridge that do not have strain gages must also be the same as the nominal gage resistance. Refer to the sensor documentation to determine this value.
The ratio of lateral strain to axial strain in the material you are measuring.
The amount in ohms of resistance in the lead wires. Ideally, this value is the same for all leads.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
member.returns: The newly created .

remarks.para: This method creates a local virtual channel for every physical channel name you specify. member.summary: Creates an to measure frequency using a frequency-to-voltage converter. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to .
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in .
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in .

The voltage level at which to recognize waveform repetitions. You should select a voltage level that occurs only once within the entire period of a waveform. You also can select a voltage that occurs only once while the voltage rises or falls.

A window, in volts, below . The input voltage must pass below minus before NI-DAQmx recognizes a waveform repetition. Hysteresis can improve the measurement accuracy when the signal contains noise or jitter.
The units to use to return the measurement.
member.returns: The newly created .

member.summary: Creates an to measure strain. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to .
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in .
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in .
The bridge configuration of the strain gage.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation in volts that the sensor requires.

The sensitivity of the strain gages and relates the change in electrical resistance to the change in strain. Each gage in the bridge must have the same gage factor. Refer to the sensor documentation to determine this value.

The output voltage of the bridge in the unloaded condition. NI-DAQmx subtracts this value from any measurements before applying scaling equations. Perform a voltage measurement on the bridge with no strain applied to determine this value.

The resistance in ohms of the gages in an unstrained position. Each gage in the bridge must have the same nominal gage resistance. The resistance across arms of the bridge that do not have strain gages must also be the same as the nominal gage resistance. Refer to the sensor documentation to determine this value.
The ratio of lateral strain to axial strain in the material you are measuring.
The amount in ohms of resistance in the lead wires. Ideally, this value is the same for all leads.
The units to use to return the measurement.
member.returns: The newly created .

Creates an that uses a thermocouple to measure temperature using a measurement on another channel for cold-junction compensation. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .
The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to . The minimum value expected from the measurement, in . The maximum value expected from the measurement, in . The type of thermocouple connected to the channel. Thermocouple types differ in composition and measurement range. The units to use to return the measurement.>The channel that acquires the temperature of the thermocouple cold-junction if you set to . You can use a global channel or another virtual channel already in the task. If the channel is a temperature channel, NI-DAQmx acquires the temperature in the correct units. Other channel types, such as a resistance channel with a custom sensor, must use a custom scale to scale values to degrees Celsius. The newly created .

Creates an that uses a thermocouple to measure temperature using a measurement on another channel for cold-junction compensation. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .

The units to use to return the temperature measurement.>The channel that acquires the temperature of the thermocouple cold-junction if you set to . You can use a global channel or another virtual channel already in the task. If the channel is a temperature channel, NI-DAQmx acquires the temperature in the correct units. member.summary:
Creates an
that uses a Wheatstone bridge to measure force or load, with the specified custom scale. Use this instance with sensors whose specifications do not provide a polynomial for scaling or a table of electrical and physical values. When you use this scaling type, NI-DAQmx uses two points of electrical and physical values to calculate the slope and y-intercept of a linear equation and uses that equation to scale electrical values to physical values. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to .
The minimum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The maximum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
The type of Wheatstone bridge configuration connected to the channel.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation, in volts, that the sensor requires.
The resistance, in ohms, of the bridge while not under load.
The first electrical value, corresponding to . Specify this value in the units specified with .
The second electrical value, corresponding to . Specify this value in the units specified with .
Specifies from which electrical units to scale data. Use the units that correspond to the units used for electrical values provided by the sensor data sheet or calibration certificate.

member.summary:
Creates an
that uses a Wheatstone bridge to measure force or load, with the specified custom scale. Use this instance with sensors whose specifications provide a table of electrical values and the corresponding physical values. When you use this scaling type, NI-DAQmx performs linear scaling between each pair of electrical and physical values. The input limits specified with the minimum value and maximum value parameters must fall within the smallest and largest physical values. For any data outside those endpoints, NI-DAQmx coerces that data to the endpoints. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .

Specifies from which electrical units to scale data. Use the units that correspond to the units used for electrical values provided by the sensor data sheet or calibration certificate.

member.summary:
Creates an
that uses a Wheatstone bridge to measure force or load, with the specified custom scale. Use this instance with sensors whose specifications provide a polynomial to convert electrical values to physical values. When you use this scaling type, NI-DAQmx requires coefficients for a polynomial that converts electrical values to physical values (forward), as well as coefficients for a polynomial that converts physical values to electrical values (reverse). If you only know one set of coefficients, use to generate the other set. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more local virtual channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to .
The minimum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The maximum value you expect to measure, in custom scaled units.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.
The type of Wheatstone bridge configuration connected to the channel.
The source of excitation.
The amount of excitation, in volts, that the sensor requires.
The resistance, in ohms, of the bridge while not under load.

The array of the forward coefficients of the polynomial. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9x3.

The array of the reverse coefficients of the polynomial. Each element of the array corresponds to a term of the equation. For example, if index three of the array is 9, the fourth term of the equation is 9y3.
Specifies from which electrical units to scale data. Use the units that correspond to the units used for electrical values provided by the sensor data sheet or calibration certificate.
Specifies to which physical units to scale electrical data.
member.returns: The newly created .

member.summary:
Creates an
that uses a Wheatstone bridge to measure torque, with the specified custom scale. Use this instance with sensors whose specifications provide a table of electrical values and the corresponding physical values. When you use this scaling type, NI-DAQmx performs linear scaling between each pair of electrical and physical values. The input limits specified with the minimum value and maximum value parameters must fall within the smallest and largest physical values. For any data outside those endpoints, NI-DAQmx coerces that data to the endpoints. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .

member.summary: Creates an to measure two-dimensional strain using a rosette strain gage. This method adds one or more physical channels to the .
member.param: The names of one or more physical channels to use to create one or more virtual strain gage channels.
One or more names to assign to the created local virtual channels.
The minimum strain you expect to measure. This value applies to each strain gage in the rosette.
The maximum strain you expect to measure. This value applies to each strain gage in the rosette
The bridge configuration for the strain gages. The possible values for this parameter are listed in .
The amount of resistance in ohms in the lead wires. Ideally, this value is the same for all leads.
The source of excitation. The possible values for this parameter are listed in .
The amount of excitation in volts supplied to the sensor. Refer to the sensor documentation to determine appropriate excitation values.

The sensitivity of the strain gages and relates the change in electrical resistance to the change in strain. Each gage in the bridge must have the same gage factor. Refer to the sensor documentation to determine this value.

The resistance in ohms of the gages in an unstrained position. Each gage in the bridge must have the same nominal gage resistance. The resistance across arms of the bridge that do not have strain gages must also be the same as the nominal gage resistance. Refer to the sensor documentation to determine this value.
The ratio of lateral strain to axial strain in the material you are measuring.
The type of the rosette. The possible values for this parameter are listed in .
The orientation, in degrees, of the gage with respect to the preferred X axis.

An array of that specifies the virtual channels to create for the rosette measurements. For each rosette sensor, this method creates one strain virtual channel for each strain gage in the rosette, and one rosette virtual channel for each measurement specified in the rosette measurements array. .
member.returns: The newly created .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

remarks.para: This method creates a local virtual channel for every physical channel name you specify. If you create multiple local virtual channels with one call to this method, you can specify a comma-delimited list of names for . If you provide fewer local virtual channel names in than you create, NI-DAQmx automatically assigns names to the local virtual channels. If you use this input to provide your own names for the virtual channels, you must use the names when you refer to these channels in other methods.

For each rosette sensor, this method creates one strain virtual channel for each strain gage in the rosette, and one rosette virtual channel for each measurement specified in the rosette measurements array. For the type, at least 2 physical channels are required. For the and types, at least 3 physical channels are required. You are also able to specify a multiple of the required number of physical channels to create the virtual channels necessary for multiple rosette sensors. The order of these channels is critical for proper rosette measurements and should be in the order of the gages in the rosette. The gages in the rosette are typically labeled as A, B, and C or 1, 2, and 3 which is the order required by DAQmx. The DAQmx physical channel constant lists all physical channels on devices and modules installed in the system. You also can wire a string that contains a list or range of physical channels to this input.

If you do not define a value for this input, NI-DAQmx creates a default channel name. The format of this name is rosette#_TYPE, where # is an index number incremented to the first unique value, and TYPE is the channel type. Name FormatType
rosette#_strainGage1
Strain gage 1.
rosette#_strainGage2
Strain gage 2.
rosette#_strainGage3
Strain gage 3.
rosette#_principalStrain1
Principal strain 1.
rosette#_principalStrain2
Principal strain 2.
rosette#_principalStrainAngle
Principal strain angle.
rosette#_cartesianStrainX
Cartesian strain X.
rosette#_cartesianStrainY
Cartesian strain Y.
rosette#_cartesianShearStrainXY
Cartesian shear strain XY.
rosette#_maximumShearStrain
Maximum shear strain.
rosette#_maximumShearStrainAngle
Minimum shear strain.

remarks.para: This method creates a local virtual channel for every physical channel name you specify. If you create multiple local virtual channels with one call to this method, you can specify a comma-delimited list of names for . If you provide fewer local virtual channel names in than you create, NI-DAQmx automatically assigns names to the local virtual channels.

If you do not provide a value for , NI-DAQmx uses the as the local virtual channel name. If you use to create a name for the local virtual channel, you must use this name in other properties and methods.

The NI-DAQmx driver does not determine if the requested settings are possible until the task is verified. does not throw an exception for parameter values that are not compatible with your hardware or other settings in your task. To determine if all of the settings for a are valid, you must verify the task by starting the task, either with or by reading from or writing to the task, or by calling with .

The grouping of digital lines into one or more objects. If you specify one or more entire ports with , you must set to .
member.remarks:
You can group digital lines into one or separate them into multiple objects. If you specify one or more entire ports with by using port physical channel names, you cannot separate the ports into multiple channels. To separate ports into multiple channels, use this method multiple times with a different port each time.
If you do not specify a value for , NI-DAQmx uses the physical channel name for the virtual channel name. If you use to create a name for the local virtual channel, you must use that name when you refer to this channel in other NI-DAQmx properties and methods.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIChannelCollection.CreateFrequencyChannel(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIFrequencyStartingEdge,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIFrequencyMeasurementMethod,System.Double,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a with the specified custom scale to measure the frequency of a digital signal. This method adds one channel to the .
member.returns: The newly created .
member.param: The names of the counters to use to create the virtual channel.
The name to assign to the created channel. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to .
The minimum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The maximum value expected from the measurement, in units.
The edges between which to measure the frequency.
The method to use to calculate the frequency of the signal.

The length of time to measure the frequency of a digital signal when is . Measurement accuracy increases with increased measurement time and with increased signal frequency. If you measure a high-frequency signal for too long, the count register might roll over, resulting in an incorrect measurement.

The value by which to divide the input signal, when is . The larger the , the more accurate the measurement. However, too large a value might cause the count register to roll over, resulting in an incorrect measurement.
The name of the custom scale to apply to the local virtual channel.

remarks.para: With the exception of devices that support multi-counter tasks, you can create only one at a time with this function because a task can contain only one . To read from multiple counters simultaneously, use a separate task for each counter.
This method creates a virtual channel for the physical channel name you specify.

If you do not provide a value for , NI-DAQmx uses the as the local virtual channel name. If you use to create a name for the local virtual channel, you must use this name in other properties and methods.

The NI-DAQmx driver does not determine if the requested settings are possible until the task is verified. does not throw an exception for parameter values that are not compatible with your hardware or other settings in your task. To determine if all of the settings for a are valid, you must verify the task by starting the task, either with or by reading from or writing to the task, or by calling with .

member.summary: Creates a that uses an angular encoder to measure angular position. This method adds one channel to the .
member.param: The names of the counters to use to create the virtual channels. You can pass a string that contains a list or range of counters to this input.
The name to assign to the created channel. To use the physical channel name as the local virtual channel name, set this value to .
The count and interpretation of the pulses that the encoder generates on signal A and signal B. , , and are valid for quadrature encoders only. is valid only for two-pulse encoders.
Whether to use z indexing for the channel.
The value, in , to which to reset the measurement when signal Z is high, and signal A and signal B are at the states you specify with .

The states that signal A and signal B must be at while signal Z is high for NI-DAQmx to reset the measurement. If the signal Z is never high while the signal A and signal B are high, for example, you must choose a phase other than .

The number of pulses that the encoder generates per revolution. This value is the number of pulses on one of either the A signal or the B signal, not the total number of pulses on both the A and B signals.
The starting angle of the encoder. This value is in the units that you specify in the parameter.
The units to use to return angular position measurements from the channel.

remarks.para: With the exception of devices that support multi-counter tasks, you can create only one at a time with this function because a task can contain only one . To read from multiple counters simultaneously, use a separate task for each counter.
This method creates a virtual channel for the physical channel name you specify.

If you do not provide a value for , NI-DAQmx uses the as the local virtual channel name. If you use to create a name for the local virtual channel, you must use this name in other properties and methods.

and decoding are more sensitive to smaller changes in position than encoding, with being the most sensitive. However, more sensitive decoding is more likely to produce erroneous measurements if vibration exists in the encoder or other noise exists in the signals.

When signal Z goes high and how long it stays high varies from encoder to encoder. Refer to the documentation for the encoder to determine the timing of signal Z with respect to signal A and signal B.

The NI-DAQmx driver does not determine if the requested settings are possible until the task is verified. member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogUnscaledReader.ReadInt16(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads one or more unscaled 16-bit integer samples from one or more objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
member.returns: A 2D array of unscaled 16-bit integer samples from the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from that channel. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.
member.remarks:
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogUnscaledReader.BeginReadInt16(System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read of one or more unscaled 16-bit integer samples from one or more objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: To get the read data or any exceptions that occurred during an asynchronous read initiated with , call with the returned .
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogUnscaledReader.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that marshals event-handler and callback calls.
member.value: The representing the object that marshals the event-handler and callback calls. The default value is .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
When the value of this property is , event-handler and callback calls are raised in the default manner. This behavior could mean that the calls happen from a thread other than the main thread. Avoid this behavior by setting this property to an object that implements , such as a or .
For more information, refer to
Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogUnscaledReader.SynchronizeCallbacks
member.summary: Specifies how events and callback delegates are invoked.
member.value: if events and callbacks are invoked through or . Otherwise, events and callbacks are invoked directly. The default value is .
member.remarks:
In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. Therefore, you must take special care when accessing objects that have thread affinity, such as UI controls, from these callbacks and event handlers. For more information, refer to
Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Library
Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogUnscaledWriter.Write(System.Boolean,System.UInt16[0:,0:])
member.summary: Writes one or more unscaled 16-bit unsigned integer samples to one or more objects in a task.
member.param: If set to this method automatically calls if you do not explicitly call it.

A 2D array of samples to write to the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample to write to each channel. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task. The order of the lines in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the lines to the channel.
member.remarks:
If the task uses on-demand timing, this method returns only after the device generates all samples. If the task uses any timing type other than on-demand, this method returns immediately and does not wait for the device to generate all samples. Your application must call the method to block until the device has generated all samples.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
has a non-zero lower bound.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogUnscaledWriter.EndWrite(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous write initiated with .
member.param: An that represents an asynchronous call started by calling .

remarks.para: If you call before the asynchronous write represented by the provided is complete, waits for the write to complete before returning. For a write to a buffered task, the write is considered complete when all of the written samples have been transferred to the task buffer. Use or on the object to determine if a task has generated all of the data it was configured to generate.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.exception: is or is not an instance of returned from a call to .
The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error during the asynchronous operation.
The data provided to had a non-zero lower bound.
member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library
