NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
has a non-zero lower bound.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AnalogUnscaledWriter.BeginWrite(System.Boolean,System.UInt32[0:,0:],System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous write of one or more unscaled 32-bit unsigned integer samples to one or more objects in a task.
member.param: If set to this method automatically calls if you do not explicitly call it.

A 2D array of samples to write to the task. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample to write to each channel. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task. The order of the lines in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the lines to the channel.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the write is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the write is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous write request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: Pass the returned to to get any exceptions that occurred during the asynchronous write or to wait for the write to complete.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

members.member:
Specifies how events and callback delegates are invoked.
if events and callbacks are invoked through or . Otherwise, events and callbacks are invoked directly. The default value is .
In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. Therefore, you must take special care when accessing objects that have thread affinity, such as UI controls, from these callbacks and event handlers. For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Library Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ScaleType
member.summary: Specifies the type of custom scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ScaleType.Table
member.summary: An array of raw values is mapped to an array of corresponding scaled values, with all other values scaled proportionally.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ScaleType.RangeMap
member.summary: Values are scaled proportionally from a range of raw values to a range of scaled values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ScaleType.Polynomial
member.summary: Values are scaled by using an nth order polynomial equation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ScaleType.Linear
member.summary: Values are scaled linearly.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal
member.summary: Specifies the name of the trigger, clock, or event to export.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.CounterOutputEvent
member.summary: Signal a counter generates. Each time the counter reaches terminal count, this signal toggles or pulses.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.AIHoldCompleteEvent
member.summary: Signal an E Series device generates when the device latches analog input data (the ADC enters "hold" mode) and it is safe for any external switching hardware to remove the signal and replace it with the next signal. This event does not indicate the completion of the actual analog-to-digital conversion.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.AdvanceCompleteEvent
member.summary: Signal a switch product generates after it both executes the command(s) in a scan list entry and waits for the settling time to elapse.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.Timebase20MHz
member.summary: Output of an oscillator that is the onboard source of the Master Timebase. Other timebases are derived from this clock.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.AIConvertClock
member.summary: Clock that causes an analog-to-digital conversion on an E Series device. One conversion corresponds to a single sample from one channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.ReferenceTrigger
member.summary: Trigger that establishes the reference point between pretrigger and posttrigger samples.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.AdvanceTrigger
member.summary: Trigger that moves a switch to the next entry in a scan list.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.SampleClock
member.summary: Clock the device uses to time each sample.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.StartTrigger
member.summary: Trigger that begins a measurement or generation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.WatchdogExpiredEvent
member.summary: The signal that a static DIO device generates when the watchdog timer expires.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.ChangeDetectionEvent
member.summary: The signal that a static DIO device generates when the device detects a rising or falling edge on any of the lines or ports you selected when you configured change detection timing.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExportSignal.ReferenceClock10MHz
member.summary: Output of an oscillator that you can use to synchronize multiple devices.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ExternalCalibrationSession.Setup1102(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures the calibration task for an SCXI-1102 module.
member.param: The physical channel(s) to calibrate.
The gain setting to calibrate.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
You can measure calibration input/output points by supplying reference signals to the specified channel and measuring the outputs.
The terminal on which to measure module output depends on the configuration of the module in MAX. National Instruments recommends cabling the module to the digitizer so that the output appears on the MCH0 pins of the rear signal connector. Refer to the SCXI-1102/B/C User Manual for more information on the routing of module output.

member.param: The physical channel(s) to calibrate.
The gain setting to calibrate.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
You can measure calibration input and output points by supplying reference signals to the specified channel and measuring the outputs.
The terminal on which to measure module output depends on the configuration of the module in MAX. National Instruments recommends cabling the module to the digitizer so that the output appears on the MCH0 pins of the rear signal connector. Refer to the SCXI-1141/1142/1143 User Manual for more information on the routing of module output.

member.summary: Adjusts the external calibration constants for an SCXI-1142 module.
member.param: The known voltage, in volts, to use as a reference for calibration.
The measured output, in volts, for the channel.
member.remarks: You must connect a known voltage to the module. You must specify the voltage with and specify the measured output with .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelWriter
member.summary: Contains methods for writing samples to a single counter output channel in a counter output task.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelWriter.#ctor(NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to write to the specified .
member.param: The to write to.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
Each object contains a property that serves as the connection point for the writer classes to provide samples to be generated by that task.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.

member.summary: Writes a time sample to a single in a counter output task.
member.param: If set to this method automatically calls if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to if you have installed events on the task.
A sample to write to the task.
member.remarks:
NI-DAQmx scales the generated data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelWriter.BeginWriteSingleSample(System.Boolean,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CODataTime,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous write of a time sample to a single in a counter output task.
member.param: If set to this method automatically calls if you do not explicitly call it. You cannot set this parameter to if you have installed events on the task.
A sample to write to the task.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the write is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the write is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous write request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: Pass the returned to to get any exceptions that occurred during the asynchronous write or to wait for the write to complete.

NI-DAQmx scales the generated data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelWriter.EndWrite(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous write initiated with any of the counter asynchronous write methods, such as .
member.param: An that represents an asynchronous call started by calling any of the counter asynchronous write methods, such as .

remarks.para: If you call before the asynchronous write represented by the provided is complete, waits for the write to complete before returning. For a write to a buffered task, the write is considered complete when all of the written samples have been transferred to the task buffer. Use or on the object to determine if a task has generated all of the data that it was configured to generate.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.exception: is or is not an instance of returned from a call to one of the counter asynchronous write methods, such as .
The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error during the asynchronous operation.
member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelWriter.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that marshals event-handler and callback calls.
member.value: The representing the object that marshals the event-handler and callback calls. The default value is .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
When the value of this property is , event-handler and callback calls are raised in the default manner. This behavior could mean that the calls happen from a thread other than the main thread. Avoid this behavior by setting this property to an object that implements , such as a or .
For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelWriter.SynchronizeCallbacks
member.summary: Specifies how events and callback delegates are invoked.
member.value: if events and callbacks are invoked through or . Otherwise, events and callbacks are invoked directly. The default value is .
member.remarks: In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. Therefore, you must take special care when accessing objects that have thread affinity, such as UI controls, from these callbacks and event handlers. For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Library
Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterMultiChannelWriter.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that marshals event-handler and callback calls.
member.value: The representing the object that marshals the event-handler and callback calls. The default value is .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
When the value of this property is , event-handler and callback calls are raised in the default manner. This behavior could mean that the calls happen from a thread other than the main thread. Avoid this behavior by setting this property to an object that implements , such as a or .
For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SinglePoint.WaitForNextSampleClock(System.Double)
member.summary: Waits until the next pulse of the sample clock occurs.
member.param: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, to wait for the next sample clock pulse. If the time elapses, this method returns an error. If you set timeout to 1, this method waits indefinitely.
member.returns: Specifies whether the next sample clock is late.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

remarks.para: If an extra sample clock pulse occurs between calls to this method, the second call returns an error or warning and waits for the next sample clock pulse. Use the property to specify whether this method returns errors or warnings.
Use this method to ensure I/O cycles complete within sample clock periods. National Instruments recommends you use this method for certain applications only.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SinglePoint.WaitForNextSampleClock
member.summary: Waits until the next pulse of the sample clock occurs, with a timeout value of 10 seconds.
member.returns: Specifies whether the next sample clock is late.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

remarks.para: If an extra sample clock pulse occurs between calls to this method, the second call returns an error or warning and waits for the next sample clock pulse. Use the property to specify whether this method returns errors or warnings.
Use this method to ensure I/O cycles complete within sample clock periods. National Instruments recommends you use this method for certain applications only.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SinglePoint.ConvertLateErrorsToWarnings
member.summary: Specifies if and reading from the task convert late errors to warnings. NI-DAQmx returns no late warnings or errors until the number of warmup iterations you specify with execute.
member.value: Specifies if and reading from the task convert late errors to warnings. NI-DAQmx returns no late warnings or errors until the number of warmup iterations you specify with execute.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SinglePoint.NumberOfWarmupIterations
member.summary: Specifies the number of loop iterations that must occur before and reading from the task return any late warnings or errors. The system needs a number of iterations to stabilize. During this period, a large amount of jitter occurs, potentially causing reads and writes to be late. The default number of warmup iterations is 100. Specify a larger number if needed to stabilize the system.
member.value: Specifies the number of loop iterations that must occur before and reading from the task return any late warnings or errors. The system needs a number of iterations to stabilize. During this period, a large amount of jitter occurs, potentially causing reads and writes to be late. The default number of warmup iterations is 100. Specify a larger number if needed to stabilize the system.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockTimingResponseMode
member.summary: Specifies how the device responds to the sample clock and to triggers.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockTimingResponseMode.SingleCycle
member.summary: Device responds by the next sample clock edge.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleClockTimingResponseMode.Multicycle
member.summary: Device acquires or generates samples on the next sample clock edge, but does not respond to certain triggers until a few sample clock edges later. Refer to device documentation for information about which triggers the multicycle response mode affects. This response mode allows higher data transfer rates at the cost of increased latency for responding to triggers.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AOPowerUpOutputBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the analog output state of the physical channels for some devices when your computer is powered on or the device is reset in NI-DAQmx.
member.remarks: For all NI-DAQmx simulated devices, power-up states are not persisted.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AOPowerUpOutputBehavior.HighImpedance
member.summary: High-impedance state.
member.remarks: You can set high-impedance power-up states only for physical channels that support high-impedance output.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AOPowerUpOutputBehavior.Current
member.summary: Current output.
member.remarks: You can set current power-up states only for physical channels that support current output.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AOPowerUpOutputBehavior.Voltage
member.summary: Voltage output.
member.remarks: You can set voltage power-up states only for physical channels that support voltage output.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanBreakMode
member.summary: Specifies the action to take between each entry in a scan list.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanBreakMode.BreakBeforeMake
member.summary: When advancing to the next entry in the scan list, disconnect all previous connections before making any new connections.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanBreakMode.NoAction
member.summary: When advancing to the next entry in the scan list, leave all previous connections intact.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanRepeatMode
member.summary: Specifies if the task advances through the scan list multiple times.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanRepeatMode.Continuous
member.summary: The task returns to the beginning of the scan list when it reaches the end of the scan list.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchScanRepeatMode.Finite
member.summary: The task advances through the scan list one time only. NI-DAQmx ignores any Advance Triggers after completing the scan list.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchChannelUsage
member.summary: Specifies how you can use the channel. Using this property acts as a safety mechanism to prevent you from connecting two source channels, for example.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchChannelUsage.ReservedForRouting
member.summary: You can use the channel only to complete routes within a switch.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchChannelUsage.Source
member.summary: You can use the channel only as an input for a signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SwitchChannelUsage.Load
member.summary: You can use the channel only as the output for a signal passing through the switch.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIStrainGageConfiguration.FullBridgeI
member.summary: Four active gages with two pairs subjected to equal and opposite strains.

member.summary: Four active gages with two aligned with maximum principal strain and two Poisson gages in adjacent arms.

member.summary: Four active gages with two aligned with maximum principal strain and two Poisson gages in opposite arms.

member.summary: Two active gages with one aligned with maximum principal strain and one Poisson gage.

member.summary: Two active gages with equal and opposite strains.

member.summary: Single active gage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIStrainGageConfiguration.QuarterBridgeII
member.summary: Single active gage and one dummy gage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRosetteType.Rectangular
member.summary: A rectangular rosette consists of three strain gages, each separated by a 45 degree angle.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRosetteType.Delta
member.summary: A delta rosette consists of three strain gages, each separated by a 60 degree angle.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRosetteType.Tee
member.summary: A tee rosette consists of two gages oriented at 90 degrees with respect to each other.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRosetteMeasurementType.PrincipalStrain1
member.summary: The maximum tensile strain coplanar to the surface of the material under stress.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRosetteMeasurementType.PrincipalStrain2
member.summary: The minimum tensile strain coplanar to the surface of the material under stress.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRosetteMeasurementType.PrincipalStrainAngle
member.summary: The angle at which the principal strains of the rosette occur.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRosetteMeasurementType.CartesianStrainX
member.summary: The tensile strain coplanar to the surface of the material under stress in the X coordinate direction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRosetteMeasurementType.CartesianStrainY
member.summary: The tensile strain coplanar to the surface of the material under stress in the Y coordinate direction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRosetteMeasurementType.CartesianShearStrainXY
member.summary: The tensile strain coplanar to the surface of the material under stress in the XY coordinate direction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRosetteMeasurementType.MaximumShearStrain
member.summary: The maximum strain coplanar to the cross section of the material under stress.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRosetteMeasurementType.MaximumShearStrainAngle
member.summary: The angle at which the maximum shear strain of the rosette occurs.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeScaleType
member.summary: Specifies the scaling type to use when scaling electrical values from the sensor to physical units.
member.remarks: Specifies the scaling type to use when scaling electrical values from the sensor to physical units. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeScaleType.None
member.summary: Do not scale electrical values to physical units.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeScaleType.TwoPointLinear
member.summary: You provide two pairs of electrical values and their corresponding physical values. NI-DAQmx uses those values to calculate the slope and y-intercept of a linear equation and uses that equation to scale electrical values to physical values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeScaleType.Table
member.summary: Map an array of electrical values to an array of corresponding physical values, with all other values scaled proportionally. If you specify this scaling type, and must be within the smallest and largest physical values. For any data outside those endpoints, NI-DAQmx coerces that data to the endpoints.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeScaleType.Polynomial
member.summary: Scale values by using an Nth order polynomial equation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeConfiguration.FullBridge
member.summary: Sensor is a full bridge. If you set to , NI-DAQmx divides the measurement by the excitation value. Many sensors scale data to native units using scaling of volts per excitation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeConfiguration.HalfBridge
member.summary: Sensor is a half bridge. If you set to , NI-DAQmx divides the measurement by the excitation value. Many sensors scale data to native units using scaling of volts per excitation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeConfiguration.QuarterBridge
member.summary: Sensor is a quarter bridge. If you set to , NI-DAQmx divides the measurement by the excitation value. Many sensors scale data to native units using scaling of volts per excitation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIBridgeConfiguration.NoBridge
member.summary: Sensor is not a Wheatstone bridge.

member.summary: Specifies whether this channel will disable excitation after the task is uncommitted. Setting this attribute to tExcitationIdleOutputBehaviorMaintainExistingValue leaves the excitation on after task uncommit.

Setting this to tExcitationIdleOutputBehaviorZeroVoltsOrAmperes disables excitation after task uncommit. member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode
member.summary: Specifies the ADC timing mode, controlling the tradeoff between speed and effective resolution. Some ADC timing modes provide increased powerline noise rejection. On devices that have an AI Convert clock, this setting affects both the maximum and default values for . You must use the same ADC timing mode for all channels on a device, but you can use different ADC timing modes for different devices in the same task.
member.remarks: Specifies the ADC timing mode, controlling the tradeoff between speed and effective resolution. Some ADC timing modes provide increased powerline noise rejection. On devices that have an AI Convert clock, this setting affects both the maximum and default values for . You must use the same ADC timing mode for all channels on a device, but you can use different ADC timing modes for different devices in the same task. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode.HighResolution
member.summary: Increases resolution and noise rejection while decreasing conversion rate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode.HighSpeed
member.summary: Increases conversion rate while decreasing resolution.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode.Best50HzRejection
member.summary: Improves 50 Hz noise rejection while decreasing noise rejection at other frequencies.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode.Best60HzRejection
member.summary: Improves 60 Hz noise rejection while decreasing noise rejection at other frequencies.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAdcTimingMode.Custom
member.summary: Use to specify a custom value controlling the tradeoff between speed and resolution.

member.summary: Do not perform an autozero.

member.summary: Perform an auto zero at the beginning of the acquisition. This auto zero task might not run if you have used previously in your task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIAutoZeroMode.EverySample
member.summary: Perform an auto zero at every sample of the acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferMechanism.Dma
member.summary: Direct Memory Access. Data transfers take place independently from the application.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferMechanism.Interrupts
member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application. Using interrupts increases CPU usage because the CPU must service interrupt requests. Typically, you should use interrupts if the device is out of DMA channels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferMechanism.ProgrammedIO
member.summary: Data transfers take place when you call reading from the task or writing to the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIDataTransferMechanism.UsbBulk
member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application using a USB bulk pipe.

member.summary: Transfer data from the device when more than half of the onboard memory of the device fills.

member.remarks: Specifies the type of compression to apply to raw samples returned from the device. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.summary: Do not compress samples.

member.summary: Remove unused bits from samples. No resolution is lost.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.AIRawDataCompressionType.LossyLsbRemoval
member.summary: Remove unused bits from samples. Then, if necessary, remove bits from samples until the samples are the size specified with . This compression type limits resolution to the specified sample size.

member.summary: Direct Memory Access. Data transfers take place independently from the application.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DODataTransferMechanism.Interrupts
member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application. Using interrupts increases CPU usage because the CPU must service interrupt requests. Typically, you should use interrupts if the device is out of DMA channels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DODataTransferMechanism.ProgrammedIO
member.summary: Data transfers take place when you call reading from the task or writing to the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DODataTransferMechanism.UsbBulk
member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application using a USB bulk pipe.

member.summary: Specifies the method to use to measure the frequency of the signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIFrequencyMeasurementMethod.LowFrequencyOneCounter
member.summary: Use one counter that uses a constant timebase to measure the input signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIFrequencyMeasurementMethod.HighFrequencyTwoCounter
member.summary: Use two counters, one of which counts pulses of the signal to measure during the specified measurement time.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIFrequencyMeasurementMethod.LargeRangeTwoCounter
member.summary: Use one counter to divide the frequency of the input signal to create a lower-frequency signal that the second counter can more easily measure.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIFrequencyMeasurementMethod.DynamicAveraging
member.summary: Uses one counter and automatically configures the counter settings based on the range of frequencies to be measured. During the acquisition, the counter dynamically adjusts the number of periods that are averaged to balance measurement accuracy and latency.

member.summary: Increment the count on rising edges of signal A. Decrement the count on rising edges of signal B.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIGpsSyncMethod.IrigB
member.summary: Use the IRIG-B synchronization method. The GPS receiver sends one synchronization pulse per second, as well as information about the number of days, hours, minutes, and seconds that elapsed since the beginning of the current year.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIGpsSyncMethod.Pps
member.summary: Use the PPS synchronization method. The GPS receiver sends one synchronization pulse per second, but does not send any timing information. The timestamp measurement returns the number of seconds that elapsed since the device powered up unless you set .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIGpsSyncMethod.None
member.summary: Do not synchronize the counter to a GPS receiver. The timestamp measurement returns the number of seconds that elapsed since the device powered up unless you set .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIDataTransferMechanism.Dma
member.summary: Direct Memory Access. Data transfers take place independently from the application.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIDataTransferMechanism.Interrupts
member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application. Using interrupts increases CPU usage because the CPU must service interrupt requests. Typically, you should use interrupts if the device is out of DMA channels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIDataTransferMechanism.ProgrammedIO
member.summary: Data transfers take place when you call reading from the task or writing to the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CIDataTransferMechanism.UsbBulk
member.summary: Data transfers take place independently from the application using a USB bulk pipe.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COConstrainedGenerationMode
member.summary: Specifies constraints to apply when the counter generates pulses. Constraining the counter reduces the device resources required for counter operation. Constraining the counter can also allow additional analog or counter tasks on the device to run concurrently. For continuous counter tasks, NI-DAQmx consumes no device resources when the counter is constrained. For finite counter tasks, resource use increases with the frequency regardless of the constraint mode. However, fixed frequency constraints significantly reduce resource usage, and fixed duty cycle constraint marginally reduces it.
member.remarks: Specifies constraints to apply when the counter generates pulses. Constraining the counter reduces the device resources required for counter operation. Constraining the counter can also allow additional analog or counter tasks on the device to run concurrently. For continuous counter tasks, NI-DAQmx consumes no device resources when the counter is constrained. For finite counter tasks, resource use increases with the frequency regardless of the constraint mode. However, fixed frequency constraints significantly reduce resource usage, and fixed duty cycle constraint marginally reduces it. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COConstrainedGenerationMode.Unconstrained
member.summary: Counter has no restrictions on pulse generation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COConstrainedGenerationMode.FixedHighFrequency
member.summary: Pulse frequency must be above 7.63 Hz and cannot change while the task runs. In this mode, the duty cycle has 8 bits of resolution.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COConstrainedGenerationMode.FixedLowFrequency
member.summary: Pulse frequency must be below 366.21 Hz and cannot change while the task runs. In this mode, the duty cycle has 16 bits of resolution.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.COConstrainedGenerationMode.Fixed50PercentDutyCycle
member.summary: Pulse duty cycle must be 50 percent. The frequency can change while the task runs.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CODataTransferMechanism
member.summary: Specifies the data transfer mode for the device. For buffered operations, use DMA or USB Bulk. For non-buffered operations, use Polled.
member.remarks: Specifies the data transfer mode for the device. For buffered operations, use DMA or USB Bulk. For non-buffered operations, use Polled. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo
member.summary: Specifies the point in the buffer at which to begin a read operation. If you also specify an offset with , the read operation begins at that offset relative to the point you select with this property. The default value is unless you configure a Reference Trigger for the task. If you configure a Reference Trigger, the default value is .
member.remarks: Specifies the point in the buffer at which to begin a read operation. If you also specify an offset with , the read operation begins at that offset relative to the point you select with this property. The default value is unless you configure a Reference Trigger for the task. If you configure a Reference Trigger, the default value is . Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo.FirstSample
member.summary: Start reading samples relative to the first sample acquired.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo.CurrentReadPosition
member.summary: Start reading samples relative to the last sample returned by the previous read. For the first read operation, this position is the first sample acquired or the first pretrigger sample if you configured a reference trigger for the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo.ReferenceTrigger
member.summary: Start reading samples relative to the first sample after the reference trigger occurred.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo.FirstPretriggerSample
member.summary: Start reading samples relative to the first pretrigger sample. You specify the number of pretrigger samples to acquire when you configure a reference trigger.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadRelativeTo.MostRecentSample
member.summary: Start reading samples relative to the next sample acquired. For example, use this value and set to -1 to read the last sample acquired.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadOverwriteMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to overwrite samples in the buffer that you have not yet read.
member.remarks: Specifies whether to overwrite samples in the buffer that you have not yet read. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadOverwriteMode.OverwriteUnreadSamples
member.summary: When an acquisition encounters unread data in the buffer, the acquisition continues and overwrites the unread samples with new ones. You can read the new samples by setting to and setting to the appropriate number of samples.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadOverwriteMode.DoNotOverwriteUnreadSamples
member.summary: The acquisition stops when it encounters a sample in the buffer that you have not read.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.LoggingMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable logging and whether to allow reading data while logging. Log mode allows for the best performance. However, you cannot read data while logging if you specify this mode. If you want to read data while logging, specify Log and Read mode.
member.remarks: Specifies whether to enable logging and whether to allow reading data while logging. Log mode allows for the best performance. However, you cannot read data while logging if you specify this mode. If you want to read data while logging, specify Log and Read mode. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.LoggingMode.Off
member.summary: Disable logging for the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.LoggingMode.Log
member.summary: Enable logging for the task. You cannot read data using reading from the task when using this mode. If you require access to the data, read from the TDMS file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.LoggingMode.LogAndRead
member.summary: Enable both logging and reading data for the task. You must use reading from the task to read samples for NI-DAQmx to stream them to disk.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation
member.summary: Specifies how to open the TDMS file.
member.remarks: Specifies how to open the TDMS file. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation.Open
member.summary: Open an existing TDMS file, and append data to that file. If the file does not exist, NI-DAQmx returns an error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation.OpenOrCreate
member.summary: Open an existing TDMS file, and append data to that file. If the file does not exist, NI-DAQmx creates a new TDMS file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation.CreateOrReplace
member.summary: Create a new TDMS file, or replace an existing TDMS file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.TdmsLoggingOperation.Create
member.summary: Create a new TDMS file. If the file already exists, NI-DAQmx returns an error.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadWaitMode
member.summary: Specifies how reading from the task waits for samples to become available.
member.remarks: Specifies how reading from the task waits for samples to become available. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadWaitMode.WaitForInterrupt
member.summary: Check for available samples when the system receives an interrupt service request. This mode is the most CPU efficient, but results in lower possible sampling rates.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadWaitMode.Poll
member.summary: Repeatedly check for available samples as fast as possible. This mode allows for the highest sampling rates at the expense of CPU efficiency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadWaitMode.Yield
member.summary: Repeatedly check for available samples, but yield control to other threads after each check. This mode offers a balance between sampling rate and CPU efficiency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReadWaitMode.Sleep
member.summary: Check for available samples once per the amount of time specified in .

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRelativeTo
member.summary: Specifies the point in the buffer at which to write data. If you also specify an offset with , the write operation begins at that offset relative to this point you select with this property.
member.remarks: Specifies the point in the buffer at which to write data. If you also specify an offset with , the write operation begins at that offset relative to this point you select with this property. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRelativeTo.FirstSample
member.summary: Write samples relative to the first sample.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRelativeTo.CurrentWritePosition
member.summary: Write samples relative to the current position in the buffer.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRegenerationMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to allow NI-DAQmx to generate the same data multiple times.
member.remarks: Specifies whether to allow NI-DAQmx to generate the same data multiple times. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRegenerationMode.AllowRegeneration
member.summary: Allow NI-DAQmx to regenerate samples that the device previously generated. When you choose this value, the write marker returns to the beginning of the buffer after the device generates all samples currently in the buffer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRegenerationMode.DoNotAllowRegeneration
member.summary: Do not allow NI-DAQmx to regenerate samples the device previously generated. When you choose this value, NI-DAQmx waits for you to write more samples to the buffer or until the timeout expires.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteWaitMode
member.summary: Specifies how writing to the task waits for space to become available in the buffer.
member.remarks: Specifies how writing to the task waits for space to become available in the buffer. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteWaitMode.Poll
member.summary: Repeatedly check for available buffer space as fast as possible. This mode allows for the highest sampling rates at the expense of CPU efficiency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteWaitMode.Yield
member.summary: Repeatedly check for available buffer space, but yield control to other threads after each check. This mode offers a balance between sampling rate and CPU efficiency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteWaitMode.Sleep
member.summary: Check for available buffer space once per the amount of time specified in .

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleQuantityMode
member.summary: Specifies if a task acquires or generates a finite number of samples or if it continuously acquires or generates samples.
member.remarks: Specifies if a task acquires or generates a finite number of samples or if it continuously acquires or generates samples. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleQuantityMode.FiniteSamples
member.summary: Acquire or generate a finite number of samples.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleQuantityMode.ContinuousSamples
member.summary: Acquire or generate samples until you stop the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleQuantityMode.HardwareTimedSinglePoint
member.summary: Acquire or generate samples continuously using hardware timing without a buffer. Hardware timed single point sample mode is supported only for the sample clock and change detection timing types.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType
member.summary: Specifies the type of sample timing to use for the task.
member.remarks: Specifies the type of sample timing to use for the task. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.SampleClock
member.summary: Acquire or generate samples on the specified edge of the sample clock.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.BurstHandshake
member.summary: Determine sample timing using burst handshaking between the device and a peripheral device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.Handshake
member.summary: Determine sample timing by using digital handshaking between the device and a peripheral device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.Implicit
member.summary: Configure only the duration of the task.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.OnDemand
member.summary: Acquire or generate a sample on each read or write operation. This timing type is also referred to as static or software-timed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.ChangeDetection
member.summary: Acquire samples when a change occurs in the state of one or more digital input lines. The lines must be contained within a digital input channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.SampleTimingType.PipelinedSampleClock
member.summary: Device acquires or generates samples on each sample clock edge, but does not respond to certain triggers until a few sample clock edges later. Pipelining allows higher data transfer rates at the cost of increased trigger response latency. Refer to the device documentation for information about which triggers pipelining affects. This timing type allows handshaking with some devices using the Pause trigger, the Ready for Transfer event, or the Data Active event. Refer to the device documentation for more information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WaitForNextSampleClockWaitMode.WaitForInterrupt
member.summary: Check for Sample Clock pulses when the system receives an interrupt service request. This mode is the most CPU efficient, but results in lower possible sampling rates.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WaitForNextSampleClockWaitMode.Poll
member.summary: Repeatedly check for Sample Clock pulses as fast as possible. This mode allows for the highest sampling rates at the expense of CPU efficiency.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRecoveryMode
member.summary: Specifies how NI-DAQmx attempts to recover after missing a Sample Clock pulse when performing counter writes.
member.remarks: Specifies how NI-DAQmx attempts to recover after missing a Sample Clock pulse when performing counter writes. Use this enumeration to get or set the value of .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRecoveryMode.WaitForInterrupt
member.summary: Attempt to recover when the system receives an interrupt service request. This mode is the most CPU efficient and best suited for recovery at lower pulse train frequencies.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.WriteRecoveryMode.Poll
member.summary: Repeatedly attempt to recover as fast as possible. This mode has the highest probability of recovery success at the expense of CPU efficiency.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader
member.summary: Contains methods for reading samples from the counter input channel in a task.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.#ctor(NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class to read from the specified .
member.param: The to read.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
Each object contains a property that serves as the connection point for readers to access the samples generated by that task.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.ReadSingleSampleDouble
member.summary: Reads a single sample from a counter task.
member.returns: A sample from the task. NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
member.remarks:
Use this method when counter samples are scaled to a floating-point value, such as for frequency and period measurement.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.ReadSingleSampleInt32
member.summary: Reads a sample from a counter task.
member.returns: An sample from the task.
member.remarks:
Use this method when counter samples are returned unscaled, such as for event counting.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.ReadMultiSampleDouble(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads one or more samples from a counter task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
member.returns: A 1D array of samples from the task. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel. NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

remarks.para: Use this method when counter samples are scaled to a floating-point value, such as for frequency and period measurement.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.MemoryOptimizedReadMultiSampleDouble(System.Int32,System.Double[]@,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReallocationPolicy,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads one or more samples from a single in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An initialized 1D array of samples that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel.
Dictates the reallocation behavior of . Refer to for more information.
The actual number of samples read. This is useful when the reading operation yields fewer or more samples than the actual length of .
member.returns: A reference to the parameter containing samples from the task.

remarks.para: When performing an asynchronous memory-optimized read, the size of the data buffer dynamically increases if the number of samples read exceeds the existing buffer and is . This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous counter input task. An is thrown if the buffer is not capable of holding the data and is .
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the
property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

item.description: If is or is uninitialized;
If the first dimension of does not match the number of channels; or
If is not , and is not capable of holding the required number of samples.

member.exception: There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.MemoryOptimizedReadMultiSampleDouble(System.Int32,System.Double[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads one or more samples from a single in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An initialized 1D array of samples that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel.
The actual number of samples read. This is useful when the reading operation yields fewer or more samples than the actual length of .
member.returns: A reference to the parameter containing samples from the task.

remarks.para: If the data buffer is large enough to hold the number of samples requested, this overload attempts to reuse existing memory allocated from the array to acquire data. This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous counter input task. The memory allocation for the buffer is available to a maximum of 2 GB.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the
property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

item.description: If is or is uninitialized;
If the first dimension of does not match the number of channels; or
If is not , and is not capable of holding the required number of samples.

member.exception: There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the
property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.

item.description: If is or is uninitialized;
If the first dimension of does not match the number of channels; or
If is not , and is not capable of holding the required number of samples.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.BeginMemoryOptimizedReadMultiSampleDouble(System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object,System.Double[],NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReallocationPolicy)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous memory-optimized read of one or more samples from a single in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback this is called when the read is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
An initialized 1D array of samples that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel.
Dictates the reallocation behavior of the . Refer to for more information.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: When performing an asynchronous memory-optimized read, the size of the data buffer dynamically increases if the number of samples read exceeds the existing buffer and is . This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous counter input task. An is thrown if the buffer is not capable of holding the data and is .
To get the read data or any exceptions that occurred during an asynchronous read initiated with this method, call with the returned .
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.BeginMemoryOptimizedReadMultiSampleDouble(System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object,System.Double[])
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous memory-optimized read of one or more samples from a single in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
An initialized 1D array of samples that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: If the data buffer is large enough to hold the number of samples requested, this overload attempts to reuse existing memory allocated from the array to acquire data. This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous counter input task. The memory allocation for the buffer is available to a maximum of 2 GB.
To get the read data or any exceptions that occurred during an asynchronous read initiated with this method, call with the returned .
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.BeginMemoryOptimizedReadMultiSampleInt32(System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object,System.Int32[],NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReallocationPolicy)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous memory-optimized read of one or more samples from a single in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
An initialized 1D array of samples that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel.
Dictates the reallocation behavior of the . Refer to for more information.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: When performing an asynchronous memory-optimized read, the size of the data buffer dynamically increases if the number of samples read exceeds the existing buffer and is . This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous counter input task. An is thrown if the buffer is not capable of holding the data and is .
To get the read data or any exceptions that occurred during an asynchronous read initiated with this method, call with the returned .
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.EndMemoryOptimizedReadMultiSampleDouble(System.IAsyncResult,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous read initiated with and retrieves the read samples.
member.param: An that represents an asynchronous call started by calling .
The actual number of samples read. This is useful when the reading operation yields fewer or more samples than the actual length of .
member.returns: A 1D array of samples that contains the read data. Each element in the array corresponds to a sample from the channel.

remarks.para: If you call this method before the asynchronous read is complete, it waits for the read to complete before returning.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

item.description: If is or is uninitialized;
If the first dimension of the does not match the number of channels;
If is not , and the is not capable of holding the required number of samples; or
For asynchronous reads, if is or is not an instance of returned from a call to .

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error during the asynchronous operation.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.
member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

member.returns: A string representation of the object.

member.remarks: Overrides .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.SynchronizeCallbacks
member.summary: Specifies how events and callback delegates are invoked.
member.value: if events and callbacks are invoked through or . Otherwise, events and callbacks are invoked directly. The default value is .
member.remarks: In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. Therefore, you must take special care when accessing objects that have thread affinity, such as UI controls, from these callbacks and event handlers. For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Library
Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterSingleChannelReader.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that marshals event-handler and callback calls.
member.value: The representing the object that marshals the event-handler and callback calls. The default value is .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
When the value of this property is , event-handler and callback calls are raised in the default manner. This behavior could mean that the calls happen from a thread other than the main thread. Avoid this behavior by setting this property to an object that implements , such as a or .
For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterMultiChannelReader
member.summary: Contains methods for reading samples from one or more counter input channels in a task.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterMultiChannelReader.#ctor(NationalInstruments.DAQmx.DaqStream)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class to read from the specified .
member.param: The to read.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
Each object contains a property that serves as the connection point for readers to access the samples generated by that task.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterMultiChannelReader.ReadSingleSampleDouble
member.summary: Reads a single sample from one or more objects in a task.
member.returns: A 1D array of samples from the task. Each element in the array corresponds to a channel in the task. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .
member.remarks:
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterMultiChannelReader.MemoryOptimizedReadMultiSampleDouble(System.Int32,System.Double[0:,0:]@,NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReallocationPolicy,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Reads one or more samples from one or more
objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.

An initialized 2D array of samples that contains the read data. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from each of the channels. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .
Dictates the reallocation behavior of the read operation. Refer to for more information.
The actual number of samples per channel read. This is useful when the reading operation yields fewer samples than the actual length of .
member.returns: A reference to the parameter containing samples from the task.

remarks.para: If the data buffer is large enough to hold the number of samples requested, this overload attempts to reuse existing memory allocated from the array to acquire data. This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous analog input task.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the
property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

item.description: If is or is uninitialized;
If the first dimension of the does not match the number of channels; or
If is not , and the is not capable of holding the required number of samples.

member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error during the asynchronous operation.
There is not enough memory to carry out this operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterMultiChannelReader.BeginReadSingleSampleDouble(System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read of a single sample from one or more objects in a task.
member.param: An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: To get the read data or any exceptions that occurred during an asynchronous read initiated with , call with the returned .
NI-DAQmx scales the read data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.
NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
remarks.note: Refer to Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library for additional information.

member.seealso: Asynchronously Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Class Library

member.summary: Handles the end of an asynchronous read initiated with and retrieves the read sample.
member.param: An that represents an asynchronous call started by calling .
member.returns: A 1D array of samples from the task. Each element in the array corresponds to a channel in the task. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .

remarks.para: If you call before the asynchronous read represented by the provided is complete, waits for the read to complete before returning.
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterMultiChannelReader.BeginMemoryOptimizedReadMultiSampleDouble(System.Int32,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object,System.Double[0:,0:],NationalInstruments.DAQmx.ReallocationPolicy)
member.summary:
Begins an asynchronous read of one or more samples from one or more
objects in a task.
member.param: The number of samples to read. If you set to 1 for a continuous acquisition, the read retrieves all samples available in the buffer at the time of the read. If you set to 1 for a finite acquisition, the read behavior is set by the property of the you are reading from.
An optional asynchronous callback that is called when the read is complete. Specify if you do not want a callback when the read is complete.

A user-provided object that distinguishes this asynchronous read request from other requests. Use this parameter to provide information to the callback. Specify if you do not need to pass any additional information to the callback.

An initialized 2D array of samples that contains the read data. Each element in the first dimension of the array corresponds to a channel in the task. Each element in the second dimension of the array corresponds to a sample from each of the channels. The order of the channels in the array corresponds to the order in which you add the channels to the task or to the order of the channels you specify in .
Dictates the reallocation behavior of the read operation. Refer to for more information.
member.returns: An that represents the asynchronous call.

remarks.para: If the data buffer is large enough to hold the number of samples requested, this overload attempts to reuse existing memory allocated from the array to acquire data. This results in more efficient memory allocation when performing multiple reads with a continuous analog input task.

To get the read data or any exceptions that occurred during an asynchronous read initiated with this method, call
with the returned .
NI-DAQmx scales the returned data to the units of the measurement, including any custom scaling you apply to the channel. You specify these units with the create channel methods or the DAQ Assistant.

NI-DAQmx read and write methods time out after the amount of time specified by the
property on the task you are reading from or writing to.
Refer to Choosing an NI-DAQmx Reader or Writer for more information about memory limitations in NI-DAQmx read methods.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterMultiChannelReader.SynchronizeCallbacks
member.summary: Specifies how events and callback delegates are invoked.
member.value: if events and callbacks are invoked through or . Otherwise, events and callbacks are invoked directly. The default value is .
member.remarks: In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. Therefore, you must take special care when accessing objects that have thread affinity, such as UI controls, from these callbacks and event handlers. For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Reading and Writing with the NI-DAQmx .NET Library
Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.DAQmx.CounterMultiChannelReader.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the object that marshals event-handler and callback calls.
member.value: The representing the object that marshals the event-handler and callback calls. The default value is .
member.exception: The NI-DAQmx driver returned an error.
member.remarks:
When the value of this property is , event-handler and callback calls are raised in the default manner. This behavior could mean that the calls happen from a thread other than the main thread. Avoid this behavior by setting this property to an object that implements , such as a or .
For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries
